---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---  
![](https://www.b2i.us/profiles/images/trans.gif)  
---  
|  | ![Image for Bryan J. KnutsonPresident & Chief Executive Officer ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_10.jpg) |  | Bryan J. Knutson  
---  
President & Chief Executive Officer   
Bryan Knutson has been Titan Machinery’s Chief Executive Officer since February 2024. Bryan leverages his more than 20 years of progressive experience in sales, operations, and leadership at Titan Machinery to deliver significant value for the Company’s customers and shareholders. Bryan has been with Titan Machinery since 2002, and has performed at the highest levels as an Equipment Sales Consultant (ESC), Store Manager, Complex Manager, and held Senior Field positions including Valley Region Manager and Vice President of Titan Machinery’s North American Agriculture Equipment Business. He joined the executive leadership team in 2017 as the Company’s Chief Operating Officer and was promoted to President and Chief Operating Officer in 2022. In addition to involvement in several industry organizations and 20 groups, Bryan is past chairman and currently on the Board of Directors of the Pioneer Equipment Dealers Association representing Member Equipment Dealers in Minnesota, North Dakota and South Dakota and has served long tenures on both the Case IH Agriculture and Case Construction Dealer Advisory Boards. Bryan graduated from Concordia College-Cum Laude where he played hockey and earned academic all-conference honors.  
| ![Image for Bo LarsenChief Financial Officer and Treasurer](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_9.jpg) |  | Bo Larsen  
---  
Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer  
Bo Larsen joined Titan Machinery in 2022 as Chief Financial Officer. He oversees the financial functions for Titan Machinery including corporate services for treasury, accounting, tax, external reporting, financial planning and internal audit. Prior to joining Titan Machinery, Bo served as the Head of Finance for CNH Industrial's team focused on precision technology. Prior to that, he held various positions at Raven Industries including Director of Finance, Director of Investor Relations, and various other roles. Bo began his career as an accountant with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, and is a Certified Public Accountant. He earned a Bachelor of Business Administration and a Master of Professional Accountancy each from the University of South Dakota and an MBA from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business.  
| ![Image for David MeyerBoard Chairman and Executive Chairman](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_7.jpg) |  | David Meyer  
---  
Board Chairman and Executive Chairman  
David Meyer is our Executive Chairman and also serves as the Chairman of our Board of Directors. David co-founded Titan Machinery in 1980 on the principle of best-in-class product support, and as an early pioneer of dealer consolidation, saw the benefits of consolidating dealership resources to leverage scale, equipment and parts inventories, training, and other industry expertise to provide world-class equipment support to all our agricultural and construction customers. David served as Chief Executive Officer from 1985 until transitioning to the Executive Chairman role in February 2024. Prior to incorporating Titan in 1980, David was a partner in a JI Case/New Holland Dealership with locations in Lisbon and Wahpeton, North Dakota. Prior to that, he worked for JI Case Company. David has served on both the Case Construction and CaseIH Agriculture Dealer Advisory Boards. He is two-term past chairman and board member of the North Dakota Implement Dealers Association. David was the Midwest Region award winner and Venture Capital Award of Excellence Recipient in the 2009 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program. David is inducted in the Farm Equipment Magazine Dealer Hall of Fame and is the North American Equipment Dealer Association recipient of the 2023 Dealer of the year merit award. David is a graduate of the University of Minnesota and currently serves as a Trustee Emeritus on the University of Minnesota Foundation and was recipient of the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Business Gary S. Holmes Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2018.   
| ![Image for Jason AndersonVice President, Human Resources and Administration](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_8.jpg) |  | Jason Anderson  
---  
Vice President, Human Resources and Administration  
Jason Anderson is our Vice President, Human Resources and Administration. In 2008, Jason joined Titan Machinery as a member of the senior management team. Jason has over 20 years of human resources experience including 10 years with Cargill, Inc. Jason earned a Bachelor’s degree from Concordia College and has a Professional in Human Resources Certification (PHR) from the Society of Human Resources Management.  
| ![Image for Jesse CookVice President, Field Operations](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_6.jpg) |  | Jesse Cook  
---  
Vice President, Field Operations  
Jesse Cook worked for Titan Machinery from 2004-2016 in Store Sales and Management Leadership positions producing superior results. From 2016 to 2020 Jesse had Region Manager and Regional Vice President roles with Farmers Business Network returning to Titan Machinery as a Region Manager. In August 2022 Jesse was promoted to Vice President, Field Operations and is a member of the company’s Executive Leadership Team. Jesse was raised on a family farm in Western North Dakota, active in Community organizations, and currently serves on CaseIH Dealer Advisory Board Committees. Jesse is a graduate of North Dakota State University with degrees in Agricultural Systems Management and Business.  
| ![Image for Nathan JohnsonVice President, Technology](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_5.jpg) |  | Nathan Johnson  
---  
Vice President, Technology  
Nathan Johnson leads Information Technology for Titan Machinery. Nathan has 19 years of experience in information technology. He oversees technology for Titan including infrastructure, business systems, integrations, and digital business initiatives. Nathan joined Titan Machinery in 2005 and has held roles as Director of IT, Senior IT Manager, Systems Infrastructure Manager, and various other information technology positions.  
| ![Image for Mark MadsonVice President, Central Operations](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_4.jpg) |  | Mark Madson  
---  
Vice President, Central Operations  
Mark Madson joined Titan Machinery in April 2022 as Director of Sales and was promoted to Vice President – Central Operations in August 2022. In 1997, Mark started with Case Corporation while in college and spent 11 of the next 12 years in a variety of Sales/Marketing positions within CNH Industrial, with a 1-year stint working for Titan Machinery in store operations from 2004-2005. In 2010, Mark left CNH to join a large CAT/AGCO/CLAAS dealer as their Director of Ag Business. He spent the next 11 years leading and expanding their Ag division throughout ND, SD, and NE. Mark grew up on a family farm in rural ND and graduated from North Dakota State University with a B.S. in Agriculture Economics. He is a member of the Executive Leadership Team and serves on the Case IH Dealer Advisory Board.  
| ![Image for Christian MitterdorferVice President, Europe](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/ChristianMitterdorfer_IR.jpg) |  | Christian Mitterdorfer  
---  
Vice President, Europe  
Christian Mitterdorfer is Vice President Europe. In 2013, Christian joined Titan as the European Operations Center's first employee. Christian brings over 20 years of international management experience to the company; he has held several senior financial management positions in the equipment and oil industries. Prior to joining Titan, Christian was employed by Johnson Controls for seven years, serving as Finance Director Eastern Europe and Finance Director Manufacturing and Sales of Equipment and Parts, Europe and Africa. Christian earned his Master’s degree in Business Administration from the University of Graz, Austria.  
| ![Image for Steve NoackGeneral Counsel and Corporate Secretary](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_.jpg) |  | Steve Noack  
---  
General Counsel and Corporate Secretary  
Steve Noack is our General Counsel, Corporate Secretary, and Compliance Officer. He oversees legal matters, corporate governance, and risk management for the Company. Steve brings an extensive legal background and practical business experience to the Company, having served as associate general counsel for Otter Tail Corporation, a partner in the Vogel Law Firm, practicing in the areas of business transactions and securities law, an associate attorney in Phoenix, practicing in commercial litigation, and as Assistant Attorney General for the State of North Dakota. Steve earned his Juris Doctor degree from Cornell University (1985) and his Bachelor of Business degree from the University of Notre Dame (1982). He is also a certified public accountant.  
| ![Image for Arnie SinclairPresident, Heartland Ag Systems Division](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/110x171_ArnieSinclair_2.jpg) |  | Arnie Sinclair  
---  
President, Heartland Ag Systems Division  
Arnie Sinclair is the President of the Heartland Ag Systems Commercial Application Equipment Division of our Ag Segment. Arnie oversees the sales, product support, manufacturing and administrative functions of the Division and is a member of the Titan Machinery Executive Leadership Team. Arnie has been in Heartland Ag Systems Leadership positions since 2014. Arnie started his career with Harvestland Co-op in agronomy retail and management positions. Arnie held Senior Management and Product leadership positions from 1993-2014 with Ag Chem Equipment Company and AGCO who acquired Ag Chem in 2001. Arnie is a graduate of the University of Minnesota.  
| ![Image for Gareth WebbVice President, Australia](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_GarthW_Web_72.jpg) |  | Gareth Webb  
---  
Vice President, Australia  
Gareth Webb is Vice President Australia and joined Titan through the acquisition of O’Connors in October 2023. Gareth joined O’Connors in a sales role in 2004 and excelled in various management leadership roles within the company including parts, aftersales and operations before his appointment to the role of Chief Executive Officer in 2018. Since his 2018 appointment, Gareth has led a successful acquisition strategy while also helping O’Connors achieve the Australian dealer of the year award in four out of the six years prior to Titan Machinery’s acquisition of O’Connors. Prior to joining O’Connors, Gareth worked in public accounting. Gareth grew up on his family farm in Victoria and graduated from Deakin University with a degree in Commerce.  
  
[Privacy](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/Profiles/main/Disclaimer1.asp?BzID=2257)

![](https://www.b2i.us/profiles/images/trans.gif)  
---  
|  | ![Image for director David Meyer ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_7.jpg) |  | David Meyer  
---  
Director  
Board Chairman and Executive Chairman  
David Meyer is our Executive Chairman and also serves as the Chairman of our Board of Directors. David co-founded Titan Machinery in 1980 on the principle of best-in-class product support, and as an early pioneer of dealer consolidation, saw the benefits of consolidating dealership resources to leverage scale, equipment and parts inventories, training, and other industry expertise to provide world-class equipment support to all our agricultural and construction customers. David served as Chief Executive Officer from 1985 until transitioning to the Executive Chairman role in February 2024. Prior to incorporating Titan in 1980, David was a partner in a JI Case/New Holland Dealership with locations in Lisbon and Wahpeton, North Dakota. Prior to that, he worked for JI Case Company. David has served on both the Case Construction and CaseIH Agriculture Dealer Advisory Boards. He is two-term past chairman and board member of the North Dakota Implement Dealers Association. David was the Midwest Region award winner and Venture Capital Award of Excellence Recipient in the 2009 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program. David is inducted in the Farm Equipment Magazine Dealer Hall of Fame and is the North American Equipment Dealer Association recipient of the 2023 Dealer of the year merit award. David is a graduate of the University of Minnesota and currently serves as a Trustee Emeritus on the University of Minnesota Foundation and was recipient of the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Business Gary S. Holmes Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2018.  
| ![Image for director Frank Anglin ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/Frank_Anglin--web.png) |  | Frank Anglin  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Compensation Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=948#948), [Governance Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=947#947)  
Mr. Anglin has been a director since February 1, 2022. Mr. Anglin currently serves as the Vice President, West and South Regions, for Istate Truck Centers. Previously, Mr. Anglin, served as Chief Executive Officer, President and Director for Boyer Trucks. He also served as CEO, President, and Director for Western Peterbilt and Western Truck Centers. Mr. Anglin also served as an independent board member for Truck Bodies & Equipment International. Prior to that he held a variety of management positions during his tenure at GE and CNH Industrial (“CNH”). Mr. Anglin earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics from the Northwestern University (1984) and a Master of Business Administration degree from Harvard University (1989).   
| ![Image for director Tony Christianson ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/Tony-christianson_37Q9472.2.jpg) |  | Tony Christianson  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Compensation Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=948#948), [Governance Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=947#947)  
Mr. Christianson has been a director since January 2003. Since 1981, Mr. Christianson has been the Chair of Cherry Tree Companies, an affiliated group of investment banking, investment management and wealth management firms in Minneapolis, Minnesota. He is the managing partner of Adam Smith Companies. Mr. Christianson also currently serves as director of MetaFarms, Inc., a leading provider of information management services for animal production. Mr. Christianson received an undergraduate degree from St. John’s University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.  
| ![Image for director Stan Erickson ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/Stan_Erickson_WebsiteImage.jpg) |  | Stan Erickson  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Audit Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=946#946)  
Mr. Erickson has been a director since March 1, 2017. Mr. Erickson currently serves as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Liberty Capital, Inc., which provides capital and investment services. Mr. Erickson co-founded Liberty Capital in 2013 after retiring from a 32-year career at ZieglerCat Inc. Prior to his retirement, Mr. Erickson most recently served as President and Chief Operating Officer of ZieglerCat. Mr. Erickson currently serves on the board of directors of Electromed, Inc., where he serves as chair of the audit committee and a member of the nominating and governance committee. Mr. Erickson is a veteran of the United States Marine Corps., earned a Business degree from the University of Minnesota, and a CPA Certification.  
| ![Image for director Christine Hamilton ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/Hamilton_C_16_Business_Photo.jpg) |  | Christine Hamilton  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Audit Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=946#946), [Governance Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=947#947)  
Ms. Hamilton has been a director since March 1, 2018. Ms. Hamilton is the co-owner and managing partner of Christiansen Land and Cattle, Ltd., a large diversified farming and ranching operation in central South Dakota, and is also the co-owner of Dakota Packing, Inc., a wholesale meat distribution business. Ms. Hamilton previously served on the board of directors for the Federal Reserve Bank, Ninth District, located in Minneapolis, Minnesota, and is a director of SAB Biotherapeutics, a privately-held biopharmaceutical company. Ms. Hamilton earned her B.A. in philosophy from Smith College and her M.B.A. from the University of Arizona.  
| ![Image for director Jody Horner ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/Jody_Horner.jpg) |  | Jody Horner  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Audit Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=946#946), [Compensation Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=948#948)  
Ms. Horner has been a director since August 1, 2015 and serves as chair of the Compensation Committee. In February 2015, Ms. Horner was appointed President of Midland University, a private liberal arts college located in Fremont, Nebraska. Prior to joining Midland University, Ms. Horner spent over 30 years at Cargill, Inc., holding several leadership positions including President of Cargill Meat Solutions, President of Cargill Case Ready, President of Cargill Salt, Vice President - Corporate Global Diversity, and Vice President - Human Resources. Ms. Horner also served as the Executive Sponsor for Cargill’s worldwide business with Walmart and Sysco. At Cargill, Ms. Horner was a member of several corporate committees including the Global Business Conduct & Ethics Committee and the Global Enterprise Process, Data and Technology Committee. Ms. Horner earned a BA in Economics from St. Olaf College, Northfield, MN and an MBA from the Carlson School of Management, University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, MN.   
| ![Image for director Bryan J. Knutson ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Headshots_Web_72_10.jpg) |  | Bryan J. Knutson  
---  
Director  
Bryan Knutson has been Titan Machinery’s Chief Executive Officer since February 2024. Bryan leverages his more than 20 years of progressive experience in sales, operations, and leadership at Titan Machinery to deliver significant value for the Company’s customers and shareholders. Bryan has been with Titan Machinery since 2002, and has performed at the highest levels as an Equipment Sales Consultant (ESC), Store Manager, Complex Manager, and held Senior Field positions including Valley Region Manager and Vice President of Titan Machinery’s North American Agriculture Equipment Business. He joined the executive leadership team in 2017 as the Company’s Chief Operating Officer and was promoted to President and Chief Operating Officer in 2022. In addition to involvement in several industry organizations and 20 groups, Bryan is past chairman and currently on the Board of Directors of the Pioneer Equipment Dealers Association representing Member Equipment Dealers in Minnesota, North Dakota and South Dakota and has served long tenures on both the Case IH Agriculture and Case Construction Dealer Advisory Boards. Bryan graduated from Concordia College-Cum Laude where he played hockey and earned academic all-conference honors.  
| ![Image for director Richard Lewis ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/100x144_2024_Titan_Richard_Lewis_Web_72.jpg) |  | Richard Lewis  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Compensation Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=948#948), [Governance Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=947#947)  
Mr. Lewis has been a director since February 1, 2024. A resident of Australia, Mr. Lewis currently serves as director and the principal executive of Iron Capital Group, a company founded by Mr. Lewis in 2015. Iron Capital Group offers equipment leasing solutions to earthmoving and mining customers in Australia and North America. Previously, Mr. Lewis was employed in various positions in the equipment finance and dealership industries. Mr. Lewis served as a director of the Australian Tractor and Machinery Association from 2002-2008, holding the position of chairperson for his final two years. In 2011, Mr. Lewis became a director of O’Connor & Sons Pty. Ltd. and was serving as Board Chair at the time of Titan’s acquisition of the O’Connors’ dealership business in October 2023. Mr. Lewis earned a Bachelor of Business in Banking and Finance from Monash University, Melbourne, Australia (1992).  
| ![Image for director Richard Mack ](https://s3.amazonaws.com/b2iweb.irpass.cc/2257/mack-0001-rgb_white.jpg) |  | Richard Mack  
---  
Director  
Titan Machinery Committee Membership(s):[Audit Committee](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/profiles/investor/CommitteesInfo.asp?BzID=2257&ID=946#946)  
Mr. Mack has been a director of Titan Machinery since June 4, 2015 and serves as chair of the Audit Committee. From June 2014, through January 2018, Mr. Mack served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer for Mosaic. Prior to that, Mr. Mack held the position of Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for Mosaic from the date of its initial public offering in 2004, until his promotion to Executive Vice President in 2009. In the decade prior to Mosaic's formation, he served in various legal capacities at Cargill, Inc, and was a founding executive of Mosaic and Cargill Ventures. Mr. Mack also serves as a director of Anuvia Plant Nutrient Holdings, LLC, including it's Audit Committee Chair. Mr. Mack holds a bachelor’s degree in accounting from Minnesota State University-Moorhead, a Juris Doctor from Hamline University School of Law and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.  
  
[Privacy](https://ir.titanmachinery.com/Profiles/main/Disclaimer1.asp?BzID=2257)

When was Titan Machinery’s initial public offering?The company went public on December 06, 2007. How is Titan Machinery’s stock traded?Titan Machinery trades on the NASDAQ Stock Market LLC under the symbol “TITN”. Does Titan Machinery have any preferred stock?No, the Company does not currently have any preferred stock. Does Titan Machinery pay a dividend?No, the Company does not currently pay a dividend. Does Titan Machinery have a direct stock purchase plan?Titan Machinery does not currently offer a direct stock purchase plan at this time. How many shares does the Company have outstanding?As of January 31, 2024, there were 22.5 million diluted shares outstanding. When does Titan Machinery’s fiscal year end?January 31. How many people does Titan Machinery employ?As of January 31, 2024, Titan had a total of 3,604 employees further broken down as follows:2,282 full-time and 218 part-time employees in North America, 721 full-time and 18 part-time in Europe and 335 full-time and 30 part-time in Australia. How many retail locations does Titan Machinery operate?As of January 31, 2024, Titan Machinery operates 80+ North American dealerships in North Dakota, South Dakota, Iowa, Idaho, Kansas, Missouri, Montana, Minnesota, Nebraska, Wyoming, Wisconsin, Washington and Colorado. Internationally, Titan operates in 36 European dealerships located in Bulgaria, Germany, Romania, and Ukraine and 15 Australian dealerships in New South Wales, South Australia, and Victoria in Southeastern Australia. What states do you operate in?As of January 31, 2024, we operate in North Dakota, South Dakota, Iowa, Idaho, Kansas, Missouri, Montana, Minnesota, Nebraska, Wyoming, Wisconsin, Washington, and Colorado. Who is Titan Machinery’s investor relations contact?ICR, Inc.Jeff Sonnek646-277-1263 Who is Titan Machinery’s stock transfer agent?Computershare1-800-962-4284web.queries@computershare.com  Who is Titan Machinery’s independent registered public accounting firm?Deloitte & Touche LLP
